entry.title: a train derailment and a six-day disruption (Wiki - Did u know)
entry.content: ... that fixing a "Null ID" error could have prevented a train derailment and a six-day disruption (pictured)?

entry.title: Michael Gardener (Wiki - Did u know)
entry.content: ... that Michael Gardener preached a sermon in Inuktitut even though he did not yet understand the language?

entry.title: East River Generating Station (Wiki - Did u know)
entry.content: ... that the East River Generating Station in New York City was opened by the Queen of Romania?

entry.title: Prince Thagara (Wiki - Did u know)
entry.content: ... that Prince Thagara was so handsome that the future Queen Supayalat disguised herself as a man just to get a glimpse of him?

entry.title: a women's association in Japan (Wiki - Did u know)
entry.content: ... that a women's association in Japan used linens hung up to dry to monitor pollution from a nearby power station?

entry.title: the owner of more than 2,000 pornographic films (Wiki - Did u know)
entry.content: ... that the owner of more than 2,000 pornographic films is the most prolific filer of copyright lawsuits in the US?

entry.title: Storer House (Wiki - Did u know)
entry.content: ... that The New York Times likened the design of Storer House to The Matrix?

entry.title: Signe Salén (Wiki - Did u know)
entry.content: ... that physician Signe Salén was denied a pension because she treated fewer than 18,000 patients per year?

entry.title: their calculus books (Wiki - Did u know)
entry.content: ... that Caltech students called their calculus books "Tommy 1" and "Tommy 2"?
